content:
Executability: Fully Executable
Check:
  all:
    - name: variable_name #suitable for variable level metadatacheck, req wild card to select all charcter variable values -> way of aliasing all variables ?  this is a check across all char vars.
      operator: longer_than
      value: 200

Core:
  Id:
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Variable Value must not be greather than 200 characters long
Outcome:
  Message: Variable value is greather than 200 characters long
  Output Variables:
    - 
Rule Type: Record Data
  
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name:  ADaMIG
        Version: '1.3'
        References:
          - Origin:  ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '17'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: In developing naming conventions, sponsors should
                  consider the requirements noted in the eCTD guidance document as
                  well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements
                  (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).
                Document: Model v2.1
                Item: '1'
                Section: 4.1.2
              - Cited Guidance: To ensure compliance with SAS Version 5 transport
                  file format and Oracle constraints, all ADaM variable names must
                  be no more than 8 characters in length, start with a letter (not
                  underscore), and be composed only of letters (A-Z), underscore (_),
                  and numerals (0-9). All ADaM variable labels must be no more than
                  40 characters in length. All ADaM character variables must be no
                  more than 200 characters in length.
                Document: ADaM IG v1.3
                Item: '1'
                Section: 3.1.1

      - Name:  ADaMIG
        Version: '1.2'
        References:
          - Origin:  ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '17'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: In developing naming conventions, sponsors should
                  consider the requirements noted in the eCTD guidance document as
                  well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements
                  (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).
                Document: Model v2.1
                Item: '1'
                Section: 4.1.2
              - Cited Guidance: To ensure compliance with SAS Version 5 transport
                  file format and Oracle constraints, all ADaM variable names must
                  be no more than 8 characters in length, start with a letter (not
                  underscore), and be composed only of letters (A-Z), underscore (_),
                  and numerals (0-9). All ADaM variable labels must be no more than
                  40 characters in length. All ADaM character variables must be no
                  more than 200 characters in length.''
                Document: ADaM IG v1.2
                Item: '1'
                Section: 3.1.1 

      - Name:  ADaMIG
        Version: '1.1'
        References:
          - Origin:  ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '17'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: In developing naming conventions, sponsors should
                  consider the requirements noted in the eCTD guidance document as
                  well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements
                  (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).
                Document: Model v2.1
                Item: '1'
                Section: 4.1.2
              - Cited Guidance: To ensure compliance with SAS Version 5 transport
                  file format and Oracle constraints, all   ADaM variable names must
                  be no more than 8 characters in length, start with a letter (not
                  underscore), and be composed only of letters (A-Z), underscore (_),
                  and numerals (0-9). All ADaM variable labels must be no more than
                  40 characters in length. All ADaM character variables must be no
                  more than 200 characters in length.
                Document: ADaM IG v1.1
                Item: '1'
                Section: 3.1.1
              - Cited Guidance: In developing naming conventions, sponsors should
                  consider the requirements noted in the   eCTD guidance document
                  as well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements
                  (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).
                Document: Model v2.1
                Item: '1'
                Section: 4.1.2

      - Name:  ADaMIG
        Version: '1.0'
        References:
          - Origin:  ADaM Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: '17'
              Version: '1'
            Version: '4.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: In developing naming conventions, sponsors should
                  consider the requirements noted in the   eCTD guidance document
                  as well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements
                  (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).
                Document: Model v2.1
                Item: '1'
                Section: 4.1.2
              - Cited Guidance: To ensure compliance with SAS Transport file and Oracle
                  constraints, all ADaM variable names must be no more than 8 characters
                  in length, start with a letter (not underscore), and be comprised
                  only of letters (A-Z), underscore (_), and numerals (0-9). All ADaM
                  variable labels must be no more than 40 characters in length. All
                  ADaM character variables must be no more than 200 characters in
                  length
                Document: ADaM IG v1.0
                Item: 5 (General Variable Naming Conventions)':' ADaM IG v1.0, Section
                  3, Item 5 (General Variable Naming Conventions)
                Section: '3'
  
Scope:
  #Classes:
    #Include:
      #-  
  Data Structures:
    Include:
       - ALL
  Datasets:
    Include:
      - ALL
  Domains:
    Include:
      - ALL
    include_split_datasets: true 
  Subclasses:
    Include:
      - ALL

json.Description: Variable Value must not be greather than 200 characters long

Outcome.Message: Variable value is greather than 200 characters long

Citations.Cited_Guidance: In developing naming conventions, sponsors should consider the requirements noted in the eCTD guidance document as well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).

To ensure compliance with SAS Version 5 transport file format and Oracle constraints, all ADaM variable names must be no more than 8 characters in length, start with a letter (not underscore), and be composed only of letters (A-Z), underscore (_), and numerals (0-9). All ADaM variable labels must be no more than 40 characters in length. All ADaM character variables must be no more than 200 characters in length.

In developing naming conventions, sponsors should consider the requirements noted in the eCTD guidance document as well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).

To ensure compliance with SAS Version 5 transport file format and Oracle constraints, all ADaM variable names must be no more than 8 characters in length, start with a letter (not underscore), and be composed only of letters (A-Z), underscore (_), and numerals (0-9). All ADaM variable labels must be no more than 40 characters in length. All ADaM character variables must be no more than 200 characters in length.''

In developing naming conventions, sponsors should consider the requirements noted in the eCTD guidance document as well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).

To ensure compliance with SAS Version 5 transport file format and Oracle constraints, all   ADaM variable names must be no more than 8 characters in length, start with a letter (not underscore), and be composed only of letters (A-Z), underscore (_), and numerals (0-9). All ADaM variable labels must be no more than 40 characters in length. All ADaM character variables must be no more than 200 characters in length.

In developing naming conventions, sponsors should consider the requirements noted in the   eCTD guidance document as well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).

In developing naming conventions, sponsors should consider the requirements noted in the   eCTD guidance document as well as the need to conform to the SAS Transport format requirements (e.g., the total length of the name cannot exceed 8 characters).

Citations.Item: 5 (General Variable Naming Conventions)':' ADaM IG v1.0, Section 3, Item 5 (General Variable Naming Conventions)
Citations.Cited_Guidance: To ensure compliance with SAS Transport file and Oracle constraints, all ADaM variable names must be no more than 8 characters in length, start with a letter (not underscore), and be comprised only of letters (A-Z), underscore (_), and numerals (0-9). All ADaM variable labels must be no more than 40 characters in length. All ADaM character variables must be no more than 200 characters in length
